an5.147:1.3.pli: Asakkaccaṁ deti, acittīkatvā deti, asahatthā deti, apaviddhaṁ deti, anāgamanadiṭṭhiko deti.
an5.147:1.3.en: They give carelessly. They give thoughtlessly. They don’t give with their own hand. They give the dregs. They give without consideration for consequences.

an5.147:2.3.pli: Sakkaccaṁ deti, cittīkatvā deti, sahatthā deti, anapaviddhaṁ deti, āgamanadiṭṭhiko deti.
an5.147:2.3.en: They give carefully. They give thoughtfully. They give with their own hand. They don’t give the dregs. They give with consideration for consequences.

mlDocs.title:
Numbered Discourses 5
15. At Tikaṇḍakī
147. Gifts of a Bad Person

an9.20:2.5.pli: tañca asakkaccaṁ deti, acittīkatvā deti, asahatthā deti, apaviddhaṁ deti, anāgamanadiṭṭhiko deti.
an9.20:2.5.en: But they give it carelessly, thoughtlessly, not with their own hand. They give the dregs, and they give without consideration for consequences.

an9.20:3.2.pli: tañca sakkaccaṁ deti, cittīkatvā deti, sahatthā deti, anapaviddhaṁ deti, āgamanadiṭṭhiko deti.
an9.20:3.2.en: And they give it carefully, thoughtfully, with their own hand. They don’t give the dregs, and they give with consideration for consequences.

mlDocs.title:
Numbered Discourses 9
2. The Lion’s Roar
20. About Velāma

mn110:12.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, asappuriso asakkaccaṁ dānaṁ deti, asahatthā dānaṁ deti, acittīkatvā dānaṁ deti, apaviṭṭhaṁ dānaṁ deti anāgamanadiṭṭhiko dānaṁ deti.
mn110:12.2.en: It’s when a bad person gives a gift carelessly, not with their own hand, and thoughtlessly. They give the dregs, and they give without consideration for consequences.

mn110:23.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, sappuriso sakkaccaṁ dānaṁ deti, sahatthā dānaṁ deti, cittīkatvā dānaṁ deti, anapaviṭṭhaṁ dānaṁ deti, āgamanadiṭṭhiko dānaṁ deti.
mn110:23.2.en: It’s when a good person gives a gift carefully, with their own hand, and thoughtfully. They don’t give the dregs, and they give with consideration for consequences.

mlDocs.title:
Middle Discourses 110
The Shorter Discourse on the Full-Moon Night
